channel.title: Something you guys wouldn't use
channel.description:
Well... Just felt like posting... Cause the "New Topic" button was calling out to me. I tried to resist it, but I couldn't. So here I am.
Anyways, it's a document on how the 2BPP format works (2 bits per pixel, or 2 numbers in binary). If you're wondering what this is for, it's for the Gameboy/Color (Not ONLY those consoles, and I'm sure other things use it to). In other words, it teaches you how to make an 8x8 tile from 16 bytes and a palette.
So... It took 20 minutes to learn and can be very handy. To test it out, I made a quick program: [img]http://img168.imageshack.us/img168/2981/2bpptest.png[/img]
Uhm... Yay?
~Lin

[/quote]
That post was unnecessary & pointless.

I envy your work, though it’s pointless to post in a braindead community such as this.[/quote]

Lin, post this somewhere else if this is something we wouldn’t use, why waste your time.
